meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unconstitutional.
meanings.sent1: The unconstitutionality of the law was evident to all.
meanings.sent2: The court ruled on the unconstitutionality of the new policy.
meanings.sent3: The unconstitutionality of wearing socks with sandals is a fashion crime.
meanings.sent4: The unconstitutionality of the decision cast a shadow over the entire legal system.
meanings.sent5: The unconstitutionality of the action was like a red flag waving in front of the judges.

meanings.definition: The condition of being contrary to the provisions of a constitution.
meanings.sent1: The protestors highlighted the unconstitutionality of the proposed amendment.
meanings.sent2: Legal scholars debated the unconstitutionality of the controversial law.
meanings.sent3: The unconstitutionality of eating ice cream for breakfast is a delicious rebellion.
meanings.sent4: The unconstitutionality of the decision was a thunderclap in the quiet courtroom.
meanings.sent5: The unconstitutionality of the regulation was a ticking time bomb waiting to explode.
